content.question: Consider the curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane defined by <math alttext="x squared, minus the fraction y squared over 5, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the fraction 5 x over y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the negative of the fraction 25 over y cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true about the curve in Quadrant IV ?

choices.label: The curve is concave up because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The curve is concave down because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The curve is concave up because <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The curve is concave down because <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The curve is concave up because <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
